title: Norse Sagas and Myths - 6 Penguin Classics editions
description:
The Norse Sagas and Myths are an unique body of medieval literature and rank with the world's greatest literary treasures -- as epic as Homer, as deep in tragedy as Sophocles, as engagingly human as Shakespeare.


The following Penguin Classics are in ePUB format:

* NJAL'S SAGA (Penguin Classics, 2001).  Translated with Introduction and Notes by Robert Cook.

* THE PENGUIN BOOK OF NORSE MYTHS: Gods of the Vikings (Penguin Classics, 1993).  Introduced and retold by Kevin Crossley-Holland.

* THE PROSE EDDA: Norse Mythology (Penguin Classics, 2005).  Translated with Introduction and Notes by Jesse L. Byock.

* THE SAGA OF KING HROLF KRAKI (Penguin Classics, 1998).  Translated with Introduction and Notes by Jesse L. Byock.

* THE SAGAS OF ICELANDERS: A Selection (Penguin Classics, 2000).  Preface by Jane Smiley; Introduction by Robert Kellogg.

* THE SAGA OF THE VOLSUNGS: The Norse Epic of Sigurd the Dragon Slayer (Penguin Classics, 1999).  Translated with Introduction, Notes and Glossary by Jesse L. Byock.
